Dear JACQUELINE Marie LUZI:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
1/11/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service palns for
each child and parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of the eight foster child records reviewed included an updated service plan that
was completed outside the time frame established by this rule. In this example the
updated service plan for the time period ending 08/14/2023 was identified as
completed 08/24/2023.
FOM 722-06 B The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to
capture family demographics, FTM logistical information,
needs, strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the
safety plan, and any recommendations made for the
family during the FTM. The DHS-1105, Family Team
Meeting Report, must be completed for every FTM.
Five of the eight foster child records reviewed identified at least one Family Team
Meeting (FTM) that occurred, and an 1105 form was not completed as required to
document the FTM. The first example had an FTM completed 6/20/23 without an
1105. The second example had an FTM 05/03/23 without an 1105. The third
example had an FTM 11/10/23 without an 1105. The fourth example had a FTMs
08/11/2023 and 11/16/2023 without 1105s. The fifth example had Team Decision
Meetings (TDM) on 5/11/2023 and 6/16/2023 without any completed 1105s.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. Agency
submitted a CAP for the renewal evaluation completed 11/08/2022. Areas
identified in noncompliance were 327(5)(d) and 324(4). The CAP was submitted
and approved 11/21/2022. There were no repeat noncompliance identified as a
part of this interim evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment provided a review of the agency's
progress/compliance with the corrective action plan that was submitted and
approved 11/21/2022 for the renewal evaluation that was completed 11/08/2022.
Financial Overview
The most recent financial statement/audit indicates that the agency has sufficient
financial resources to provide appropriate services.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews did not indicate any concerns at this time. Maintaining appropriate
levels of staffing was/is a challenge, but the agency was able to maintain
adequate staffing to provide services and compliance with licensing rules.
The analysts interviews with youth indicated appropriate support/services are
being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
3

The agency is well maintained and the records/files are stored consistent with
licensing requirements.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns. Interviews with caregivers and youth indicated
appropriate support services were provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
